channel.title: Merv Tweed
channel.description: Recent news about Merv Tweed, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Mentioned by CBC.ca
item.description:
Earliest possible voting day for 4 federal by-elections bumped to Oct 21
Hot off the presses comes the official word that veteran Manitoba MP and committee chair Merv Tweed will not be returning to the Hill when the House resumes this fall, as he intends to resign his seat on August 31 "to pursue opportunities in the private sector." : From his website: "I have had the honour to serve the public ... We thank him for all the hard work and dedication he has shown as our Member of Parliament, and wish him well in the next chapter of his career." said Matt Bolley, President of the Brandon-Souris ...

item.title: Mentioned by Railway Track & Structures
item.description:
OmniTRAX Canada appoints Merv Tweed as president
Merv Tweed, who recently announced his resignation from the Canadian House of Commons after serving more than nine years as the Member of Parliament for Brandon-Souris, has been appointed as president of OmniTRAX Canada. "We are very proud to ...

item.title: Mentioned by Canada.com
item.description:
Manitoba MP's new job raises ethics questions
The resignation of Manitoba Conservative MP Merv Tweed, who stepped down Monday to run a major railway company, has raised eyebrows because Tweed chaired two Commons committees whose work was of interest to the company. Photo: Handout.

item.title: Mentioned by Westman Journal
item.description:
Golf tournament's proceeds donated to charity
Brandon-Souris MP Merv Tweed recently gives a donation of $1,500 to the United Way of Brandon & District, as well as a cheque for $2,500 to the Ashley Neufeld Softball Complex. (In the photo:) MP Merv Tweed (left) donates a $1,500 cheque to Janis Evens ...
